cot.cot_output:

The Euphrates and Tigris rivers are located in the Middle East. The Euphrates river flows through Turkey, Syria, and Iraq, while the Tigris river also flows through Turkey and Iraq. Both rivers converge in the southern part of Iraq before flowing into the Persian Gulf.

The Euphrates and Tigris rivers are located in Turkey, Syria, and Iraq in the Middle East.

associate.associate_output:
The Euphrates and Tigris rivers are located in the Middle East, specifically in Turkey, Syria, and Iraq. The Euphrates river flows through Turkey, Syria, and Iraq, while the Tigris river also flows through Turkey and Iraq. Both rivers converge in the southern part of Iraq before flowing into the Persian Gulf.

The Tigris-Euphrates River Basin consists of the Tigris River and the Euphrates River, originating in southeastern Turkey and flowing through Syria and Iraq before meeting to form the Shatt Al-Arab, which flows into the Persian Gulf. The rivers are part of the Palearctic Tigris–Euphrates ecoregion, which includes Iraq and parts of Turkey, Syria, Iran, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and Jordan.

In Iraq, the Euphrates is known as "Nahr al Furat" and is navigable by very shallow-draft boats in certain areas.

Answer:
The Euphrates and Tigris rivers are located in Turkey, Syria, and Iraq in the Middle East. They form a major river system in Western Asia and are part of the Tigris-Euphrates River Basin, ultimately flowing into the Persian Gulf.

The Tigris-Euphrates River Basin consists of its two primary rivers – The Tigris River and the Euphrates River – and their minor tributaries. From its origin in Turkey, the Euphrates flows into Syria from the north, before continuing on through Iraq. The two rivers meet in Iraq to form the Shatt Al-Arab, which flows south into the Persian Gulf. The Tigris and Euphrates, with their tributaries, form a major river system in Western Asia.
